newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-NANTES UPSET AGAIN IN CUP COMPETITION.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-NANTES UPSET AGAIN IN CUP COMPETITION.

text.p: First division Nantes, Nancy and Le Havre crashed out of the French Cup on Saturday, joining Monaco as first round victims of giant-killing teams from the lower divisions.
Nantes, eliminated six days ago from the League Cup by a second division side after going 17 matches unbeaten, went down 2-1 after extra time at third division Vitrolles.
Vitrolles coach Christian Dalger said: "We put up our courage and solidarity. We also had more desire to win, that's what made the difference."

His Nantes counterpart Jean-Clause Suaudeau said: "We made the same mistakes against Vitrolles as we did in the League Cup against Louhans-Cuiseaux. That proves that by not playing at 100 percent, you lose."
Nancy and Le Havre both fell to second division opposition, respectively 3-1 after extra time at Sochaux and 2-1 to Niort.
First division leaders Monaco were upset 1-0 at second division Laval on Friday.
Holders Auxerre had no trouble beating the amateurs of minor league side Vervins 6-0.
But Bordeaux needed extra time to overcome fourth division Brive. Level 1-1 after 90 minutes, Bordeaux settled the issue with goals by Kaba Diawara and veteran Jean-Pierre Papin. (to win 3-1)
Louhans failed to repeat their League Cup victory over Nantes -- they were on the receiving end of a 5-0 thrashing by third division Creteil.
Yugoslav striker Anto Drobnjak scored twice in first division Bastia's 4-2 victory at fourth division La Roche-sur-Yon.
European Cup Winners' Cup holders Paris St Germain play at third division Besancon on Sunday.
Marseille and Lille, involved in a legal tug-of-war over which is the home team in their all-first division tie, have yet to play.
The draw for the second round in three weeks time is scheduled for Thursday.
